direction.raw_text: Ms. Mills?   Would you come with me? Margaret is excited to get away from Gilbertson.

direction.raw_text: Yes, of course. She unbuckles her seat belt, about to get out of her seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GILBERTSON What's this about?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (never done this before) There's someone on the radio for you. The flight attendant points to the Flight Attendant CB located at the front of the plane, outside the cockpit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Uh, a Richard Paxton? Margaret shakes her head and re-buckles her seat belt.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tell him I'm not here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard and his family are huddled around the radio in the tower. Chuck sits nearby.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (from radio) I'm sorry.   She won't come talk to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shit!   She's never going to pick up...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Richard) Know what, home slice?   Cut this chica loose.   You remember Beth Cable?   She'd totally be into you... Suddenly, Richard has an idea.   He picks up the hand mic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me Miss Flight Attendant, could you ask the captain to do me one more favor...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: !   The captain comes on over the loudspeaker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (over plane loudspeaker) Welcome to flight 1601 to Seattle, this is your captain.   We've reached our cruising altitude of 30,000 feet.   Flight time'll   be three hours and thirty minutes.   And Margaret?   Richard has something he'd like to say to you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (over loudspeaker) Uh, hey Margaret.   And cause I'm on the loudspeaker, hey everyone on the plane. The other passengers look around to try and figure out who's Margaret.   Meanwhile, Margaret looks down and acts like she doesn't know either.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (cont'd) (over loudspeaker) This certainly isn't how I wanted to do this.   I mean, I'm not really into the whole baring your soul in front of strangers thing, but I figure it's now or never.   So here goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard puts down the hand mic for a second to gain composure. His family encourages him on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're doing great, man. Richard pushes the button down on the hand mike.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know you're used to being on your own. And that you're comfortable with your life the way it is.   And that in a million years you wouldn't have thought that we should be together.   I know, because I felt the exact same way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Every passenger is enraptured by the words coming out of the loudspeaker.   The flight attendants, the Handsome Man, everyone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (over loudspeaker) And you know what else I know?   I know that I'm tired of being alone.   And I think you're tired of being alone too.   So come on.   Talk to me.   Please. The Handsome Man turns to Margaret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with genuine concern) Do you really feel like you're alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, good lord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Richard and his family stare at the radio, waiting to see if there is going to be an answer.   Chuck crosses his fingers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (O.S.) (from radio) What the hell are you doing? Everyone in the tower smiles.   They're making progress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We need to talk. (Intercut as necessary.   Margaret stands at the front of the plane with the passengers watching.)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: About what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever thought there might be a reason we've been together for the last three years?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As boss and assistant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things change, Margaret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Things change?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah, things change.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that the best you got? Geoffrey hits Richard, as if to say "see, that's what I said." Richard composes himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, tell me the truth.   When you left, were you relieved or sad that we didn't have an excuse to be together anymore? Geoffrey gives Richard the thumbs up.   That was a good one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because I am sick that you left.   And if you feel sick too, then why shouldn't we just be together? Margaret goes to answer, but stops.   Richard is right.   She wants to go back.   Even the passengers on the plane can see it. Gilbertson panics.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GILBERTSON Are you thinking about going back to him? Margaret doesn't answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GILBERTSON (cont'd) We have a deal!   You can't back out now! The flight attendant steps in, annoyed that Gilbertson is trying to break up Richard and Margaret.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, you need to sit down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GILBERTSON I will do no such thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, I'm ordering you to return to your seat. Other passengers yell "sit down asshole" at Gilbertson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GILBERTSON Who said that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir, this is your third and final warning!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GILBERTSON Listen sweetheart... (he pokes the flight attendant) I'm a federal officer, so why don't you get me another cocktail and mind your own...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! ZAP!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Volts of electricity surge through Gilbertson.   He twitches violently and crashes to the floor. Behind him, The Handsome Man holds a stun gun and a badge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I'm a federal Air Marshall.   And you're under arrest for disobeying a crew member, assault, and possible intoxication.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . The Handsome Man pulls out flex cuffs, zips them around Gilbertson's wrists, and throws him in the bathroom.   He then takes the CB from Margaret and speaks to the passengers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Sorry everybody, but protocol says we need to get this unruly passenger off the plane
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .   Sitka's the closest airport, so if it's OK with you, I'm gonna have the captain turn this bird around. There are wild cheers from the passengers.   Margaret blushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (winks at Margaret) Told you I was a romantic.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flight 1601 glides to a safe landing.   Richard and his family wait on the tarmac, and the plane taxis to them.   A truck drives stairs to the front door of the plane and the door opens. Margaret steps out.   Richard walks up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This wasn't supposed to happen. Richard looks Margaret in the eye.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it did. Margaret looks down.   A little embarrassed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not the kind of girl who gets saved. Richard smiles, and without warning, Margaret grabs him, and plants a long, deep, and wet kiss on him. The long kiss is interrupted by the Handsome Man and Gilbertson.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh, sorry, but excuse us. The Handsome Man leads a handcuffed and still dazed Gilbertson down the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Gilbertson) Hey!   Do you think getting arrested might affect you at work? Gilbertson has no retort.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) Oh, and I'm not going to be able to publish your book after all.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . GILBERTSON So you are getting married this weekend?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Absolutely not.   But who knows? (looking at Richard) We might by the time you get out of jail. Gilbertson makes a "go to hell" face and shuffles off. Margaret turns back to Richard.   All smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) I've got some explaining to do. Margaret and Richard walk down the steps and stand in front of Richard's family.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cont'd) (to Debbie) Hi.   I'm Margaret.   I've known your son for years, but we've just recently begun to see each other romantically. (to Geoffrey) I want to get to know you all, and spend some real time up here in Alaska. (to Annie) I'm not sure when you are going to see him get married, but I promise as long as I'm with him, he'll be happy. Passengers cram up to the plane windows to see what will happen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's all we ever wanted. Grandma Annie gives Margaret and Richard a big hug.   Debbie joins in.   Then Geoffrey.   Passengers cheer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The party is in full swing. Balzac chases his balls. Ramone slides onstage and SINGS with the band.   He has a beautiful voice. Debbie and Geoffrey cut a rug.   They've done this before.
direction.name: direction
